responses: Hello there, how can I help you?
Hi there, how can I help you?
Hello there, may I be of assistance?
See you later, I hope I was of assistance.
Bye! I hope I was able to help with your query.
Goodbye, have a nice day!
I'm more than happy to help!
Any time!
It's my pleasure!

patterns: I've run out of login attempts
responses: Providing you have internet connection, your password may have reset or you may have forgotten it. If you would like to reset your password, please go to the login page and click the 'forgotten password' hyperlink. If you require further assistance, call -support number- or visit our website for a live chat with a technician.

patterns: My computer had an error and the screen went blue
responses: Your computer may already have restarted, but if it has not then please attempt to restart it with the power button. If this issue persists, please log a case and move to another machine if possible, and let us know if you installed any drivers or external hardware before this issue.

patterns: I accidentally deleted something I need
responses: Don't panic! Check your recycle bin first, failing that search for the file with the search bar. If you're certain it's lost, log a case with us and we will be able to assist in recovery.

patterns: I closed my document without saving
I forgot to save my document
responses: If your work is in Office, these programs have an AutoRecover feature that should give you an autosaved version of your work. Many other programs have a feature similar to this.

Firstly, try closing any unused programs and browser tabs. Check that no software updates are occurring, and then check the space on your local disk. Failing these steps, open a case - and do not enter any personal information if you believe there is a chance your machine is compromised.

patterns: My computer shut down out of nowhere
My PC shut down out of nowhere
responses: If it isn't turning back on, open a case. If it is, check for a lot of dust in the fan, as it may have overheated. In case of viruses, I would advise opening a case regardless if it was a random shutdown with nothing to do with things like the power connection or a necessary restart.

Ensure you have the correct printer selected and that it is turned on and has the right amount of paper, ink and toner. If these are fine, it may be a connection issue - log a case and we will ensure your PC is on the correct group.

patterns: It's difficult to connect to the internet
its difficult to connect to the internet
responses: Downloads may be affecting your speed, but if you are in office log a case.
Try connecting to a different USB port, then check to see if the device works with another machine before replacing it.

patterns: No sound is coming from my computer
responses: Ensure your speakers are on and connected. Then, right click the sound symbol and open the settings and check/test your audio devices. Check your audio drivers. You can also use the search bar to find the audio troubleshooter.
Check the power connection to the monitor, then use the buttons (usually on the bottom) and make sure it isn't on power saving or eco mode.
